bioghist.p: William Smith (1924-1993) was an associate conductor of the Philadelphia Orchestra. Smith was a pianist and musicologist who had studied at the University of Pennsylvania. He joined the orchestra as principal keyboard player in 1952 and was made assistant conductor that year. He was named associate conductor in 1976.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains numerous scores, sets of scores and parts, and sets of parts without scores. There are several arrangements by Smith. The collection also includes a photo of an orchestra with conductor, probably Leopold Stokowski, circa 1920s; a charcoal sketch, possibly of Smith; certificates, diplomas, and plaques awarded to Smith; and programs for the Philadelphia Orchestra performances, the Philadelphia Orchestra Children's Concerts, Student Concert series, and the Academy of Music's Annual Concert and Ball.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
